{"step_by_step_thinking": "After intracoronal bleaching, immediate composite restoration can be done. The bleaching process involves the use of hydrogen peroxide (H2O2) to whiten the tooth. Therefore, it would be logical to treat the tooth with H2O2 for a certain duration before proceeding with the composite restoration. Option C, treating with H2O2 for 3 minutes, seems to be the most appropriate choice.", "answer_choice": "C"}
